bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of any abnormal discharge of liquids from the human body. This includes the discharge of liquids from the skin or mucous membranes, from lesions resulting from pathological changes, and also by way of spitting/vomiting, as well as large quantities of urine or watery stool. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 23: 後六十日腫如裹水狀，如此可 刺之。但出水，後乃有血，血出即除也 , “Later, over a period of 60 days, a swelling develops resembling a water blister. At this point one may pierce it. At first, there is only a discharge of water . Later there will be blood. At the moment blood is discharged, remove [the needle]” . Liquids discharged from lesions resulting from pathological changes are also called chu zhi 出汁 . As the nature of the liquids discharged varies, authors have distinguished between chu huang shui 出黃水 , discharge of yellow water, and chu nong 出膿 , discharge of pus.
